u4C7wmQd7owwL6EqObSU6w.text: My Sister insisted we go here during our impromptu Pub Crawl. She could Not stoo talking about this place and hoe it won some award in Naples Italy for the Pizza. So bearing in mind that my Sister was Three Sheets to the Wind, I agreed to go here. The bartender, (a blonde with curly hair, curvy girl, and glasses) didn't bother to put down her phone to greet us when we walked in.  We ordered a drink and a slice of cheese pizza each. One slice was like $ 8.00!!! It was cut SO thin!! Mostly crust, dried out like it had been sitting there for 3 days. Barely and cheese. I took one bite and spit it out!!!  My Sister asked the bartender if we could have replacement peice. I got a new one. It was the same quality. My Sister kept saying that they go there during Bike Week every year. I kniw what it's like to go out partying and get wicked Hungry, stop at a place, think "Omg This is Sooooo good"!... then ho back another time sober and that same place that "soooo good" is now disgusting sauce on cardboard.  Well, THAT'S EXACTLY What this pizza tasted like. Sauce on cardboard.  Disgusting.  No way would I ever believe this place won any kind of award. I was a little buzzed, no need to go back sober cause this was already a huge fail. Never going back. Too expensive. Not worth it. Zero stars.

vrLwTfydvYvMw46D5Ejlvg.text: The crunch, the gooeyness of the cheese, the Tang of the tomatoes the but  the pizza pie crust amazing..perfect grease coming off the pepperoni burning the roof of your mouth delicious. Nothing like a sexy man making a sexy pizza thank you Josh

vri5ig9rmyMor3lyYPqpRg.text: Loved their huge pizza with sausage. Enough for four persons. Beer was draft and cold too. Great atmosphere. Just ask for Kat.

xWeE9TZgCOiwm3Jlg8uv4Q.text: Best pizza in town! This was suggested to me by a local Lyft driver, and he was definitely right that this pizza joint is better than all the others in the area.   Great price for an extremely delicious generous slice of pizza.   The garlic knots were also delicious, though in my opinion were a bit overly dense.   The Evel Kneivel theme of this place is also on point.. hipster-rock I say?  I do wish this was closer to the Strip though.

FTZ13QWCncPdE7wOlT8q3w.text: Hubby and I had three different vegan pizzas. The pesto, ricotta, and the marinara. Good lord the pizzas are incredible. The flavor and the crust is just amazing. There's no other pizza place in Vegas like Evel Pie! They are so freaking good. Hubby tried the vegan meatballs and said it was bomb. I love love love this place! Thanks for existing.

HGcQQGXASA34UzNneOFYfQ.text: Stopped in for a slice and was told it would take 10 minutes. After 30 minutes the person waiting ahead of us is already dismayed and rightfully so.    I've worked back of the house for over a decade and the staff were below incompetent. They looked at the slips like they were written in code by Stephen Hawking.    After 40 minutes the staff were actually hostile to the person ahead of us and our party as well when they were questioned about the timeliness of the slices.  And I'm not exaggerating with the word hostile.  I mean seriously. Put a slice in the oven. Then hand it to the customer.  Get a clue.    It's also not advisable to tell the customer to 'fuck off'.  The girl taking our order was awesome though.  Please don't lump her in with the incompetence of the kitchen staff.

w2GavFuwPQ5v5cKPVZ5ZyA.text: Best Pizza place in Vegas! Love their fresh ingredients, staff is amazing and location is perfect for people watching. If u are in Vegas and craving some delicious Pizza u gotta go to Evil Pie!!!!

2JnjI4vW8tQT9_GbVCJEzA.text: This place is epic! Finding good gluten free pizza is hard and finding deep dish gluten free pizza has been impossible. I came here with my wife had had some draft root beer and their gluten free deep dish and were blown away! She's from Chicago and even loved it! It was so  well cooked and the cheese and sauce were perfect. This will become a Las Vegas staple for me!

aeRieg5EbvBCpRsoDFETKA.text: This is one of my favorite places in the area. One of the best late night spots as well which is very important for this overnight person! Delivery is as perfect as eat in. Amazing pizza, amazing creations, fantastic gluten free and customizations. Anything you want they will do. Love these guys.

53woo09LGD52nS1r_nJH9Q.text: Love beer, pizza and punk rock. In this place beer is cold, pizza is hot and punk rock is loud. My favorite bar in DTLV. Noizy? Hot? Just use next door if you're not down for that.

ZV8f0zjP89L1MwuFfkb2uQ.text: Disgusting greasy thin pizza. Just gross gross gross. Bartender was very friendly and I would stop for beers next time.

PX8j0Aeu1OuMxPB3Qq-hsw.text: If you're a pizza nut like me, but just turned Vegan!!! This is it right here.  Just had their Vegan pie and it was amazing, incredible flavor, texture and taste. Vegan cheese is not what I expected. It was awesome. I'll be dreaming about this for a while.  There are many combinations to choose from. With or without vegan cheese, olive, jalapeno, mushroom, roasted pepper, onion, peppadew, pineapple etc. I highly recommend this pizza.  On week 6 of being Vegan, and this will be my new vice when it comes to a pizza craving.  Wow, double wow!

CNLvw9hUMwR7OUI6GdSKDg.text: Shame they advertise $1 pizza but apparently that's just a bribe to get you here to their shows. Asked the inside and they said out back. Ask the bartender and she rudely says no such thing. Thats odd because Im looking at their business flyer advertising that right now. Well I appreciate the run around hut ill pass next time Im looking for something to do downtown.

8Pt4F69nChSjPlXIcrrB1Q.text: Hoaky, campy, corny and stupid.  Expensive. Very expensive.  Good friendly service. Sweet as sugar bartenders.    Pizza and Evel Knievel is the theme here.   Full bar no gaming machines. Loud 60's and 70's music. Seemed like a mostly friendly gay and lesbian clientele so if you're homophobic you're still ok here.   Better places to visit close by.

LrKQxiW3AEQIyDfeTB3fhg.text: Love this place. Simple as that. Don't expect to find parking though, it's impossible. This is the place you end your night after hitting up those bars Downtown. I always get a slice of Barry White and a side of those Garlic Deez Nuts. Once you order you'll hear your name called on the megaphone from a heavily tattooed pizza pro. They also have seating in the back, which is always a nice option when you just want some peace and quiet.

XvlMs49D0DQebQ4o23Zwag.text: Stopped by at lunch for a few slices while in town on business. I ordered a slice with meat and a slice with meat and ricotta. They have clever names for all their pies and I don't remember the names of what I ordered.   The pies are New York style with a thin crust that has a nice crispy outside and soft inside.   I loved my slices so much I grabbed a slice of cheese as well.   The decor on this place is awesome. Filled with customer placed stickers and Evil Kenevil memorabilia. Tons to look at while you're enjoying the amazing pizza.

711c42FzkHukMNpvnZOrbg.text: While the atmosphere here is nice, what matters most to me is the pizza, considering it's the reason we came. The large number of positive reviews indicates I am likely in the minority, but I was really disappointed in the slice of their white pizza I ordered.  When I picked up the slice, the pizza had such a large pool of grease on top it almost seemed like they must have poured oil on it before heating it up. Then, biting into the pizza disappointingly gave way to a super chewy cheese experience (I'm guessing all the oil leeched out of the cheese, leaving the cheese as a deconstructed rubbery affair). Sadly, the flavor was bland to boot.  We did end up here after midnight, so who knows, maybe it's just an issue with the night shift. The only really positive thing I can say is that I started out hungry (having skipped dinner) and after eating the slice was satiated. But at $6 for a slice of rubbery white pizza I doubt I'll be back.

cw1FzO3H-MlWTKLenPbsMA.text: Never fails best pizza joint in law Vegas hands down! $6 slice and drink combo!!!! You won't be disappointed with the quantity and QUALITY

OcK-3Ku-YQR_MiBlzm_x5A.text: Wow!  What's a nice surprise. AMAZING NY style pizza by the slice. Parking isn't super easy but the quirky Evel Knievel-theme and the great rock music are a bonus. Do yourself a favor... make the trip downtown. Evel Pie is the real deal.

Jq6f9ODf9Jm-9WfHxPr3yQ.text: A very good pie.. taste like I was back in New York. Awesome pie shop with a full bar. Evel knievel theme. Badd ass!

6y7cJcofZBpi5ia_JOdmUw.text: Hands down the best Gluten free pizza in Vegas with a homemade crust!  It's a thick Chicago style crust that's infused with cheese, you would never know it's gluten free! The only drawback is the price, it was 52 dollars for two small pizza's. I would get it again but next time maybe just one and a salad with it to offset the price. It's sad for me to go into the shop and see the display of amazing pizza's they have with a slice as big as your arm for 5 bucks and not be able to eat whatever I like since I have a gluten issue, however I am grateful for the amazing pizza there that's Gluten free.

nBzo1zpZra2m0dIiU-65wg.text: My girl and I were recently visiting from Long Beach CA...we drunkenly stumbled upon this gem! We ate, drank, and listened to dope music while we continued to drink! We left there full, drunk, and happy! Cheap pizza and beer is a dream come True! We will definitely be back! Also, Kelly..the bartender is my new homie...a fellow Long Beach chick.....great service and vibe :)

q7G7ZCFw2tePxcC0xgPhNg.text: BOMB ASS PIZZA! Really amazing pizza. If you're downtown definitely check this place out. Gave it 4 stars cause the customer service from the blonde chick was crappy. Standoffish. Other than that, great pizza!

VcTd0eoHUwZ0hIQOqgEB1w.text: Great chill spot for a slice and drink when you're done wandering Fremont St. Recommend the Goblin Sausage and Balls to the Wall, and the bartender mixes a spot-on afternoon margarita.

y5kQMzBmse3XpPCbAYIY2g.text: The absolute best best best gluten friendly pizza I have had in five years of necessity on the GFD. I took off one star because it's far too loud to be in the restaurant. I literally got a migraine waiting for my pie. Next time I know to call in an order for pick up and then it will be the best pizza experience ever.

5ib2bOhFm3uvd87Ud5hGsA.text: This pizza place is awesome. New York giant slices...pinball...beer from a motorcycle helmet cause its vegas. The Evel Knievel stuff is fun. Come eat great pizza and play a 70s evel knievel pinball machine.

My2P2Hxqx0dYvJEupqjlPA.text: If you are vegan and/or gluten-free, EP is a must-try. I am both and their proprietary, award-winning gluten-free crust with Daiya brand vegan cheese is the best I've had in a restaurant. The deep-dish crust is light and fluffy with a slight doughy chewiness to it that arguably rivals the best non gluten-free crusts. My non gluten-free dining companions ordered the gluten-free crust and even they loved it. I will undoubtedly be dining here at least once per trip when I'm in Vegas going forward. I'd highly recommend this place to pizza lovers of all dietary preference.

mbYNRIwTEDquVeNhIEpd0g.text: Dont be fooled with the good looking pictures, infortunafely the pizzas are overpriced and super thin aside from being untasty and over salted. Need I ad the service is not great. I order two slices and in the glass theu look so great, however its just the crust that looks thick, when you get your pizza, its pretty sad.. the pizza is thin and small but the outer cruat is huge. Its like a scam lol.. its fremont.. what do you expect I guess..

ZbJ2cSkTdO97aUSu-l-S9Q.text: Great service, and wonderful pizza!  The drinks were good, and cheaper than the strip.  The service was good and the music and decor was fun

QkATKCVvklPmHUJ7tRcTxQ.text: Good vibes, good pizza, bartender did not know how to make a requested drink but took the time to try and made it bomb ! Def. coming back

2qrfCG9CVox6Vu6AHz3NIw.text: Really great pizza. You seat yourself and go up to order but the service is great. Price is good. Would be nice if a smaller pizza option was possible. We needed more than a few slices so bought the 20" pizza. We ended up giving half our pizza to a homeless guy so it didn't go to waste.

O7vwfh9CIGwm4QHtKzrTkw.text: I walked up and thought to myself 'am I even cool enough to go in here?' But we did and we were. Great staff. Amazing food. Good prices.

mZbe9e5-ynqcjofPoii60g.text: PIZZA! On Fremont in Vegas! SO GOOD and totally affordable, but price should not be an issue when it comes to good 'za (however, non-chain yummy food that doesn't bust your wallet is so great to find in Vegas!). The sauce is great, the crust is PERFECT, and for those who want it, there is a gluten free  option plus a vegan pie.  The Cheesy Rider showcases Evel Pei's pizza making skills, and showcases the sauce and crust with just the right amount of cheese. Barry White Pie--I love a white pie and this is glorious, balanced and nuanced. The World Famous Snake River Special has rattlesnake sausage (yum!), and OMG! they have man candy bacon as a topping on the Hog Heaven, and you can get it as a extra topping for other pies or slices.  They serve beer and shots as well as sodas, are open late late and freaking ROCK!

mZTF5beJhh7wL_Un9FRx0g.text: This is our second visit and we were celebrating my husband's birthday. This was his choice because he loves the food, vibe, music, atmosphere, beer selection and memorabilia. In addition to pizza, we also purchased meatballs and garlic knots and all were delicious! We highly recommend this place.

uLilWMNeLfFffIE4m81ngg.text: I chose this place based on the 4 and 5 star reviews but did not have the same experience as most others. We visited Monday August 5th. If you like Evel Knievel, this might be the only reason to go here. We stopped in after a fun night downtown on and sat down to have a couple drinks. We were told to get in line and order drinks when we order pizza. So we can't sit down and order drinks and then get in line for pizza? Nope. So we got in line. Ordered 2 slices and a couple of beers. We sat at the bar and ate our dried out pizza. It was a good thing we had the beer to wash it down with. I would not recommend this place. Save your money. There are way better places either within walking distance or a short RideShare away. If you need recommendations, see some of my other posts from my recent Vegas trip.

7Z9kWUQoQrky5wh56wMrTA.text: Cool dive. Pizza was good. Service was good. Solid above average good place to stop by for a beer and some pizza. Classic rock bar feeling.

iuwLSi3cY1VUp40-aPCRsA.text: Finally a pizza place downtown I can enthusiastically recommend to people! (Sorry radio city pizza fans I was not impressed) serving pizza by the slice and pie this place is great and open late. Nothing in Vegas can recreate New York pizza (mostly because of the water, but there are other reasons too) this comes damn close. A nice greasy slice, that's thin enough to fold and eat New York style. It's a neat Evel Kneivel theme as well with all sorts of interesting decor. Looking forward to trying the rattlesnake sausage and man candy( a maple ham and pepper mix). Say hi to bartender Kelly if you go by, she's awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni slice

nORn8uXZP0WnxDRbtL57EQ.text: I have ordered from Evel Pie, both in house and via delivery. I have NEVER had a bad experience. I love the food and their beverage selection is amazing! Best pizza in town, hands down! All the naysayers can suck it!

OuRfH4pU9-KRwT-JLjCWqQ.text: Very good pizza. Tried a pepperoni slice today and loved it. Not cheap. About $6.50 for just a slice. But beware, I then asked for a cup of water to go with it and they refused saying they don't offer water, even to paying customers. They replied back that the higher ups don't allow it because of the homeless people. Ridiculous. Rock Pizza block over doesn't do that. Rock Pizza associates are also friendlier. No water for paying customers is just a ploy to pad their tab thinking you'll buy a drink or sugar soda.

L4hw0GFtxcsC0B6Pu_qv-Q.text: I enjoyed Evel Pie. I like the theme and the feel of this place on Fremont St. The staff was all real nice even at 10PM.   I went in for their award winning gluten free pizza, because I heard it is amazing. I ordered, was told it'd be 20 minutes, but 30 minutes later I'm still waiting for my pie.   It wasn't busy, so I'm not sure why my pie sat on top of the oven for a while even though the person who took my order saw me stand up from the table getting a little impatient. I saw a pizza on top of the oven, thought it may be mine, so I slowly start inching towards the counter. Finally, someone asks if I was here for pickup and gave me the pie.   The crust is deep dish, airy, and it has that yummy browned cheese on the edges. Yup. To die for. The sauce is a little sweeter and herbaceous which I love, and it wasn't drowning in cheese which I really appreciated. Simple and to the point. The crust was a little greasy, but it is 10PM on Fremont St, so I wasn't expecting something healthy at that point.   Here's the thing. I don't expect pizza places to make an extra effort and have a gluten free crust. However, the fact that Evel Pie put a bunch of effort into making a stellar crust for those with a gluten free allergy is impressive, greatly appreciated, and pretty close to being worth the $21 for a plain cheese gluten free pizza. I'm even willing to look past the wait time. I would definitely suggest that people come and grab a bite here - gluten free or not.

kVVbcGzvVbI8b7PMlahX9Q.text: This hipster-as-fuck pizza joint slash bar just opened on Fremont street with a vintage Evel Knievel theme, and they put out some some pretty good slices! Checked this spot out with a friend from NYC and she couldn't stop at one slice, it was that good. The crust is thin yet retains a nice crunch, the cheese is generous, and the sauce actually has flavor. Pair it with a beer for a $5 combo, and you're hard pressed to find a cheaper meal in the area, let alone one that's actually good! I'll be back for the Balls to the Wall pie!

Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese slice,  coupon for grand opening for locals

DLwuLvwkGasL-ObfjqS2yA.text: GREAT PIZZA NEXT TO A TOURISTY AREA (Warning: visitors from Central Florida in for a vacation) Despite all the quirky Evel Knievel decor, I immediately liked the look of this place because it seemed familiar somehow- like it was something I'd see back in Central Florida. Or maybe I was just seeking any calm away from Fremont Street.  BIG NEW YORK STYLE SLICES I took a slice topped with pepperoni and jalapenos while Hubs wanted one topped with multiple types of meat. Our slices arrived with a pool of oil on top from the cheese and limp from the size... but we already knew this wasn't gourmet pizza. This was diner pizza- comfortable and flavorful. The price was also great.  ORDER AT THE COUNTER AND THEY'LL REHEAT There were about a dozen varieties of pizza on display. We chose what we wanted and they'd reheat and serve it to us in our seats. Next to us was a long bar full stocked. The entire vibe of the place was very chill. A little dark. It reminded me of an old city pizzeria.

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the bar area. A little side past it is where all the pizzas are displayed

bxM9LWrxulBL3kJUb4HkEA.text: I just went in for the first time. I am a fan. Its a dive bar with good pizza. I had the Balls to the Wall and the Snake River. Both are 2 really great choices. Everything was fresh and the beer and cocktail prices are great. The bartender, Kahlie, had tones of personality that came through in a quick conversation. Did I mention it is dedicated to Evel Knievel? BOOM!   Will demo be back and will be recommending this one to my clients. 2 signature slices and a 16 oz beer for 12 dollars. can't beat it with a stick.   Great place. GO!!

aD-5TDJgfBGrXGmQ8F4wWA.text: A new hip pizza joint on the renovated East end of Fremont Street, don't miss it!  A friendly local bartender suggested this place, and it didn't disappoint!  Great prices (lunch specials are just $5.00 and include a beer!).  It's nothing fancy, but if you're looking for some awesome NY style "by the slice" pizza, this is your place!  We tried both the "Balls to the Walls" and "Mystery (basically Hawaiian)" slices.  The employees had a friendly vibe, with great senses of humor.  The whole place is decked out in Evel Knievel memorabilia, and they were even offering Wild Turkey shots in honor of his birthday the night we were there!  This place has a great local and down to earth feel, so if you're tired of the buffets and fancy restaurants it's the perfect place for a quick delicious meal before heading on to Fremont street debauchery!

7GIsCdBb0ZhZuEg-CAlyFQ.text: Amazing pizza, great drinks and beer, awesome, friendly, and helpful staff. Highly recommend the meat balls and any of the pizza slices. Will definitely be coming again.

hJ0rA341pX-DFjVcxRixUg.text: Honestly, the pizza is great. One of the most flavorful slices of cheese pizza I have had the honor of eating within my twenty-something years of life. Much of an improvement from the previous F. Pigalle and Radio City Pizza tenants before. Loved the decor, the prices seemed right, et cetera.  Had to take off two stars for the staff. Considering the spot opened up six days ago, why was the staff so rude? They had the attitude of hipsters who had been there before Beauty Bar opened up. Hate to pull the hipster card but the staff was rude when we were trying to make conversation. Didn't offer us drinks, didn't greet us, wouldn't talk to us, saying we literally were too lively for them at 9pm just ordering food and no alcohol, complained about us taking too long, etc. At least if you're going to act like you're too great for everyone... earn it first. Honestly between Evel Pie and Pizza Rock, I would rather go back to the OG Pizza Rock and have friendly service.

tQDgFwMLicIwcdCMEfZ_eQ.text: I've heard all the hype about Evel Pie and was really excited to try it. I was downtown waiting for a concert to start and I remembered about the deal at Evel Pie where you get a cheese slice and PBR for $5, so I was off to grab some slices and beer. The line wasn't long inside at all, but there was a good amount of heads at tables. They have a ton of pizza options and there's a display behind a glass case showing you what they have to offer. I got a cheese slice (cheesy rider) and pepperoni slice. There's fold and eat pizza that is legit and then there's fold and eat pizza because it's so floppy you have no other choice. Sadly this pizza was the floppy kind. When I picked up the pizza slices they belly flopped. There wasn't the slightest of any structure in the crust. It didn't taste bad, but it didn't taste great either. For $5 I can see why people come in for this deal because it's perfectly doable if you are sober or drunk and the slices are big. I would stop by again when walking around downtown for the deal if friends wanted to, but I'd personally order from nearby Pizza Rock when downtown and craving pizza.  They have 20 inch whole pies here at Evel Pie that range in price from $24-$30 if you want more than a slice.   Cheesy Rider $4 per slice Pepperoni $4.50 per slice  Specialty $5.50 per slice

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. @ Evel Pie - 9/1/17
Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. @ Evel Pie - 9/1/17
Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. @ Evel Pie - 9/1/17

7_VVvJLvY7OBKImDW1loeg.text: I love the gluten free pizza here SO much! I never realized deep dish gluten free pizza existed, let alone tasted as amazing as this one does! This is genuinely my favorite pizza place in Vegas. I have never had a bad reaction after eating their GF pizzas, so I would say pretty celiac friendly! Only downside is it can be extremely loud inside.

JeG9Yh4zcKFvpe0ZK_MCnA.text: The only question you need to ask is: "Would Evel Knievel, the Man, the ultimate Badass, actually come here for pizza and a beer if he were still here?"  Yes.  This is NOT a fake, kitschy Las Vegas tourist trap, rather the excellent pizza, the ice cold beer, the loud music and genuine friendly people who work here make this place real and truly worthy of their namesake.   The perfect combination of sauce and cheese sit on top of an impossibly thin crust and easily make this one of best NY style slices I've ever had.  All of the Evel Knievel memorabilia is the "topping" on what is already a nearly perfect "pie"  Go, and enjoy the beer, the pizza and the cool Evel stuff.

8HLAth9OQ1UQS3aIOUVjsA.text: There's 3 really great pizza places downtown, Evel, Pop Up and Pizza Rock.  I can't decide who is 1, 2, or 3.  Evel Pie is excellent, 5 star slices.  Thin crust, excellent ingredients and perfect quantities.  As good a NY style slice as I've had.  I look forward to trying all 3 every visit to deliberate who's the best.

dttKEo6aUsGQQ0VCzW0r2A.text: Wow.    I was extremely skeptical about trying the HOGHEAVEN.  I usually play it safe and get something similar to a Supreme but today I decided to step out of my comfort zone and went with this.  And WOW.  At first glance before taking a bite, my thoughts were, it looked like it was going to be plain tasting as if just eating a sausage pizza with the sausage being over bearingly salty OR I was going just not going to enjoy it.    Picked up the pizza and was shocked.  My fingers weren't greasy!  I think I'm in HogHeaven!  This flavoring was wow! for my liking.  It's so hard to explain but its one of the best pizza I've had.  Everything was just right.  Not greasy, not salty, just right.  Can't wait to try the other pizzas    So with that being said, Happy Eatings!

SnXRbda7JwYVx2KWLHIHpw.text: Never did I ever think a pizza joint would beat out Pizza Rock for my favorite slice in the city.  I've been dying to check this place out for a very long time. Unfortunately I don't make it downtown anymore as much as I would like to. My sister-in-law is in town and we were in DTLV for the second night in a row.  We were headed to first Friday and wanted to make sure we had something somewhat solid in our bellies before stuffing it full of junk food. We swung through Evel Pie and picked up a slice each. I was ecstatic to see such incredible pies on display. Such fluffy crust, chewy and delightful, this place does it right. Reminds me of my East Coast home. I grabbed a pepperoni slice, which after warmed up was extremely greasy but I sucked it up with a napkin. The husband got a cheese and my sister-in-law picked up a Greek slice of pie. Holy moly, we were delighted.   The staff was super nice, real people, and I loved the atmosphere. We will absolutely make Evel Pie a regular stop in our routine. It's super helpful that it's right next to where my husband works.  We got three slices and three bottled waters for $25. The cheese slice was four dollars, pepperoni was $4.50, and the Greek slice was $5.50. Pretty reasonable for such a bad ass pie.  This so-called Evel Pie was absolutely heavenly.

IcV-4xH4sHlfLzU-aZOIUg.text: Tons of choices for slices! Slices of pizza aren't available everywhere in vegas and all the specialty slices are under $6. Low key dive bar at the same time. Has a San Diego type vibe on Fremont St!

ev5Dszen-0ds8Y0sZHoSUQ.text: This place is full of energy and tons of fun!! Came here on New Years and it's like a bar and super cool pizza joint mixed together!!   Did I mention the workers are freaking amazing!!

9niSsTcWAYY2Rq7BlPmW1Q.text: Three stars for atmosphere, 2 stars for pizza. I'm surprised it was voted best of Las Vegas, but there isn't much competition most of the spots in this city have crappy by the slice pizza.

WCT-6Z6UeqMfhG5wLZjhJw.text: Alluring store front with cool mural. Come inside to cool music and nice decor. Pizza slice, pesto for me, really good.   Coca Cola products. Maybe maybe more vegetarian options?

QITMS6MEEnh-Ck-EIPaFKg.text: Came for a quick late night bite. The whole place is poppin all night since it's in the middle of downtown. We got in line around 1 and waited 20 mins or so to order. The slices range from $4-5 and a whole pie (8 slices) is $28. With 7 people we opted for the whole pie for the better value. It took 30 mins, kinda long but it was a really good pizza. We got the goblin sausage, really good 10/10 would recommend.

3AeVdB3qS29iXKDO8aNC7w.text: Was very loud so you couldn't hear much especially the names called to pick up your order. Because of this we sat a very long time waiting then finally went up to the counter to have a worker grab the two slices ordered stacked on top of each other on high equipment in the back. Pizza tasted good and were good sized slices but they were sadly not hot.

_-Z86nNB0riO2rb6F7Eu_Q.text: Dude I love this place. Damn good thin crust pizza. Peeps are cool and everyone is welcome there. Try to hit happy hour (see pic) you can get a cheese pizza & a pitcher of beer for $20. Best damn deal in Vegas right there! If you can't eat the entire pizza take it with you for a late night snack, give it to a homeless dude or share with friends that you meet while watching free live bands on Fremont street. This place is a staple, we stumbled across it a few Vegas trips ago & now it's a must stop every time we go!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s a whole pizza right there!
Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour! Best deal around!!!
Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. To go box is cool

7rLARK03d_jNC3-ufPFLkw.text: Very loud environment be prepared. We had 3 different slices between 4 people. The first was the Goblin Sausage and when delivered it was piping hot as was the Pulled Pork BBQ one. The Goblin was covered in a very fresh tomato sauce, it was bright and had touches of garlic and oregano. Covered with sausage. It was very good. The pulled pork was covered with too sweet BBQ sauce for me. The pork was well smoked and tender. I added pepper flakes to give it the heat I like. Really good if you like BBQ. The third was the Veggie and I didn't try it. You could tell by looking at it, it was not very hot, which was the only complaint. It was devoured so I am assuming it was still good. Go and enjoy a very NY crust, loved the crunchy and chewy crust, it was fantastic!

9ByZpFs-DAGGcIoC90sS9A.text: EVEL PIE PIZZA ROCKS!  Tonight we stopped by to enjoy some pizza and support a few local music artist as well as pies for paws event.   The Pizza is so darn good, we debated on getting a whole pie or some slices so that we could sample a few of our favorites!  We opted for delicious slices of the following!  World Famous Snake River Special- mozarella, rattlesnake sausage, carmelized onions and roasted red peppers.  Barry White- mozzarella, pecorino, fontina and ricotta.   Hog Heaven- bbq sauce, smoked mozarella, fontina, pulled pork, man candy bacon, red onions.   Classic Pepperoni  Garlic deez knots- garlic, pecorino & parsley with their famous Evel's tomato sauce.  The pizza is always delicious, fun and flavorful!  My favorite Evel house specialty pizza is HOG HEAVEN, that yummy bbq sauce and pulled pork brings me to climax.

wmxuJNzFOA2CHKU105kSkw.text: Hot little spot in the midst of THE Fremont Street Experience.  We were starving and even with all there is to do and see in this wild town sometimes you need that late night pizza slice.  The pizza was delicious, the drinks cold and the service is excellent. It's just a bit divey and full of fun characters ... and Evel Knieval stuff but what else could you want!

YbvXm6kOqGfesdaypeNzDQ.text: have a gluten allergy, and I have never been able to find a gluten-free pizza that satisfied my pizza craving until now. I got the Olivia Gluten-Free John with pesto sauce. Ohhhh my God, it was deep dish. Are you kidding me? How did they even do that? It was fluffy, and soooooooo good. I couldn't even believe it. It was the best gluten free thing I have ever eaten.  We came here after our friends renewed their wedding vows. There were 15 of us. We ordered lots of food, and all of it was good. Service was stellar. The place itself had so much cool stuff to look at. I will definitely come here EVERY TIME I come to Vegas in the future!

wNwn4TBaxLF2G9jipvrGNQ.text: I like this place but ever since I saw them discriminate against a homeless man, that was willing to pay for a pizza, I now choose to never come back. They need to learn manners and that all customers matter. Out of all the people in line they only asked the homeless man to throw away his water. Yea water! Water is free! Why does it matter!? All people matter!

B1SWfpmlxJoelf7lDZbEHg.text: Wooowww. The pizza here is surprisingly good. They have a $6 cheese slice and a beer, it's a steal! I think it might be in the top 5 best pizza I've ever had. It's a very clean establishment with a cool vibe. It seems like a lot of locals hang out here. The staff is friendly and service is fast, this will be my go to spot in downtown for sure!

1ci6xwp-hfbZv2IotiXYaA.text: DAYYYYYYYYYUMMMMM! This place is so fun. Excellent tunes. Delicious flavor. Delightfully witty bartender.   There was a kind of annoying patron there named Roger but that's not the restaurants fault.   Altogether, two very enthusiastic thumbs up. Jolly good time.

I3nj3GS5gHDErszq0CBGVQ.text: This was the best pizza. I had the Barry White! Yum. So good. Bring ya friends and share the garlic knots! Fun place with good music and well drinks.   They have a mystery slice! Do it!

Wdb0_Tog7T1vuKHrOxzvvQ.text: Edited post: Normally i enjoy this restaurants normal pizza and its good bit i was in the mood for pan pizza. This review is only for this location's gluten free square pizza. I called ahead and asked if it was comparable to the normal pizza. They said its worth trying so i ordered it. Unfortunately it wasn't  as good as thier Normal pizza. while i have to admit i am ignorant when it comes to gluten free food. This pizza was airy and light. But not for me. You can tell alot about a business when they go out of there way to make a product for a select few who normally could not enjoy it. The owner and employees here go above and beyond to make sure your visit is the best it can be and for that i thank you.

jx47qrr0j_Kl3QCEol4_vA.text: Awesome place, a neighborhood dive bar feel that doubles as a pizzeria.. they have a great deal that includes a beer and cheese pizza slice for $6. Awesome deal when you are bar hopping in the downtown area.

8UCLxcju5dwdwbVIayWhUQ.text: Vegan vegan vegan (and live music) I went here for a few punk shows and was so impressed by the vegan options they offered! The vegan pizza can have vegan cheese or none, and they've got vegan meatballs they can cook up, too! The live music choices are sweet, and the staff is awesome. Definitely hit this place if you haven't already.

EXoVPaSgeoSY4RJcTR1ckw.text: Love the pizza/atmosphere and their online-media presence.....whoever is their PR needs like a 1500% raise ! So creative and ahead of the curve!  Who doesn't love Evel ?  Original bad ass...

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza and a brew !!! Can&#39;t go wrong !!!

xQMOxSOyG_bqeVa1AnbUqw.text: Came here last night for some food while wandering around Freemont street. There were five of us total. The service was super fast and friendly. We went up to the counter to order different slices and beer, and were told to sit and wait for our names to be called. We didn't have to wait long.  Their special which I did is a beer and a slice of cheese pizza for 6 dollars. It's a good deal, you get a pint of PBR and a big slice of pizza. The beer was nice and cold which was good. The pizza is obviously the star of the show. The crust was light and chewy and had great flavor to it. It wasn't too dense and the dough wasn't too much in relation to the sauce and toppings. The sauce was a red sauce that had a touch of sweetness to it. And they made sure the slice was super cheesy. None of the ingredient outshone another one. They all complimented each other very well.  I have to say I was impressed that even though we all ordered separately we all got our slices within a good timeframe so no one was waiting too long. I was lap impressed that when one slice came out a bit toasty on the edges the person behind the counter told us that a new one was being made but we could have that one while we wait for the other to cook. The toasty pizza wasn't even that toasty and we said that we didn't need another slice but within a few minutes another slice had magically appeared at the table. Of course we couldn't turn it down and it was definitely not wasted. It was definitely a great experience between the service and the food itself. I will definitely be back.

fOpGAvmVnhv7vX0FDXFt9A.text: Evel Pie hits the spot, any time of day! Fun vibe inside, normally possible to find (or share) a table. Must try these slices, they're the best that it gets as far as affordable, slice-by-slice, and often late-night pizza goes.

R0XPnrFX25IbksTjDtOG8g.text: I went there last night, I went to the bar to order a pizza. They said I had to wait in line, but were serving other people at the bar. I asked if I sat at the bar would they serve me, they said yes. So I was at the bar. The couple next to me got there after, ordered their pizza and were served their pizza before I was. I asked why I haven't received my pizza yet as I was at the bar, they said I had to go in line after I already ordered. The manager DONNA let me sit there for 30 minutes waiting, while the people next to me got served. Unacceptable customer service, I immediately asked for a refund. Worst service I have ever experienced. I usually don't write reviews but how are not going to serve someone waiting that long after they paid. I will never go there again and tell everyone I know not to ever go there. So many other places to get food at in downtown, don't go there!

xlNvlaCu8Jv3O0sawbmp1w.text: Not gonna be mean or anything but only stating my experience. I grew up eating New York style pizza and eating a slice of cheese brought back memories. All that grease dripping off the cheesy slice but the other one; sausage, onions and hot peppers, I think, really wasn't hot.

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Definitely reminded me of the good old days except the price!Wow! I&#39;ve had $5 slices in places that kinda blew this place out the water.idk

G1T7SlYqDwBLcQfOWYApqQ.text: Totally impressed and in love with this place! Balls to the Wall ($5.50/slice) was my favorite because of the perfectly caramelized onions that paired well with the meatballs. 1 slice is definitely filling, but I "accidentally" ate 2 because I couldn't help myself!  Not only are the slices generous but all the flavors offered were also very unique. Of course there are the classic ones like pepperoni and cheese, but if you're in the area, I recommend giving their specialty pies a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Balls to the Wall

7cfV0p8wpaAhIyKKHgjLNA.text: Even though I had one too many drinks prior to eating here, I enjoyed every bit of that pizza! Man, probably some of the best slices I've ever had, no joke. Perfectly cooked and the cheese to sauce ratio was great. Can you guys come to San Diego?!

nLOr_PsWL3189Zh74zWrlg.text: Great NY style pizza, cheap drinks, awesome music and service. In addition to great food and service Evel Pie was a leader in providing food and supplies to victims and first responders in the days following 1 October. Support this great American owned business

ly5KjGEu7uR7CKIxeuVKTQ.text: I ate here a couple times and im a pizza snob from philly/NY area so im basing this off how it would do there.   You gotta yell your order over a glass wall but its not too bad. The restaurant has a hipster feel with really cool vintage evel stuff. The people that worked the days i went were pretty nice.   But im here to judge pizza. Its thin crust, which is what i like. I just dont think the taste is there to be considered a 'killer' spot. Ive had easily 20 better pizzas in my life. So the price justification isnt quite there and the hype is not met.  I guess it could be good for those that live here and dont get access to bomb pizza. Overall not too bad,  but id rather eat Rosati's thin crust or Biaggios just in vegas alone. They just lack branding and dont buy awards.

SOHPVytkOmBtJKMQp78ztw.text: We tried a couple pizza places downtown.  Yuck.  Fortunately, we found this place.  YUMMY!  Pretty sure it might be the best pizza in Las Vegas!  Check it out!!

UHRXcpYbsr-Qiao-6wLVYg.text: This Evel Knievel themed pizza place is an interesting place to stop on Fremont east. They have tasty New York style thin crust pizza, and other Italian cuisine. The smell of the pizza cooking draws you in off of the street! The pizza is good- not quite "East coast" good, but I would eat here again. They have a full bar also. There's a variety of Evel Knievel memorabilia hanging on the walls to glance at while waiting. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The prices were right for a quick stop off for a slice and a drink.

fPa8J1VJbVsqpdsPDXndew.text: They have an ORIGINAL Evil Knievel pinball machine!!!!!!! They also have some KILLER pizza!!!! This place has an off the charts cool factor going for it, I watched Knievel break every bone in his body flying over shit on his Harley when I was a kid, so this place brought back ALOT of good memories!!!! I'd DEFINATELY return!!

uGor027vuLZrQbBgbQzoBg.text: Great cool pizza place, came here after having a terrible experience at another restaurant down the street. Really loved the decor inside, looked like they knew what they were doing and they did it well. Pizza was tasty, not crazy about the sauce but the toppings and bread we're fantastic. Would come again

gbky2ldp29so-1QJNc4YdQ.text: You must visit this place! Pizza is amazing and the team is awesome! Definitely worth your way to stop by! Thanks team!

YX0uKwRN7i4umrK13HzR9A.text: Great pizzas and wings. The atmosphere is cool as well. We watched the superbowl at a local bar and decided to buy a pizza and wings because the bar had no food but said we could bring in any food. Wasn't expecting much, but we were blown away at how good the pizza was. I will def go back again! Great customer service as well, all employees were super chill.

EkHCqSQkVXnL34OmwPNicw.text: Loved this place! The pizza is delicious, the Evel Knievel decor and atmosphere is fun, there's an Evel Knievel pinball machine to play, and the location near the corner of Fremont Street and Las Vegas Blvd is perfect!  Tip: Get the Passport parking App for easy street parking in the Downtown East area.  Pizzas are sold whole pie, as well as by the slice - and the single slices are very big! There's one Gluten free pizza option available for those who want gluten free The meatballs are delicious!  Good beer selection!  Note: order at the bar/counter, then pick up when they call your name from their bullhorn!  The only dis-merits I gave for this establishment: 1) Music was upbeat and fun.. but a bit too loud. It was nearly impossible to have a conversation with our group of friends who dined together when we visited last week. We would have preferred  the volume to be turned town a couple of notches. 2) Tables are a little too close together (Personally, I'd like just a teensy bit more space between each table)  Thus a solid 4-star rating. In fact, I'd give it a 4.5 rating if that was an option!

AOUncai0aCyP4JytHTcVfQ.text: Friendly staff and fun place to hang out. Tried the rattlesnake pie and it was grrreat! Huge slices, so get the full pie of you are really hungry.

wH1JFd5Hdagx-ECLgyY_UA.text: Such a fun place that is tucked away, definitely a Vegas must!! The employees were awesome and so very helpful! Pies were delicious, great prices, and an awesome atmosphere!

bY7SBKGCknYIu8KNo8V3KQ.text: So the pizza actually isn't that great unless you're a few drinks in. I would have taken a photo but I was honestly too grossed out. They had a giant cockroach walking across the table next to us. Take it as you want but the employee there killed it and went on about his day as if it's a common thing. Ew. EW.

NFpc4JAx3AJ_LjQ2YZTizA.text: We heard about this place & decided to try it, pretty cool collection dedicated to Evel Knievel. Interesting bar, quite the variety of beers, stiff shots, cool music, a slice of pizza, & there ya go! Interesting vintage memorabilia a groovy trip back to the 70's for sure, the vintage beer selection is a throwback at its best with Hamms & Schlitz on the menu! Hubby & I cracked up at that one, you will get a kick outta this place for sure! Pretty cool to stop in for a drink a slice, and some nostalgia when your on Fremont St.  I Would Like To Add A Special Thank You To Branden & Kirsten For Doing Such A Great Job With All The Music There It Is Quite A Eklectic Mix Of 70's Genre & It Takes You Back!

2ybp4LoDGeWbr-nyJzVWkg.text: THE BEST FUCKING PLACE EVER! Great pizza and we ended up spending 3 hours here because of Virginia and "scary Gary" their bar tender and bar back.  Coolest, sweetest, kind folk I've met in a while. Pizza was fantastic, flavorful, and the entire atmosphere was dope as fuck. It will be our frequent the next time we visit. Not to mention I realized that I had stickers in my purse and was able to stick them up. It's like a cleaner version of the double down with Pizza! Virginia and scary Gary my faves. THANKS GUYS!

84xsOTYpLstMWNVV-ItGDg.text: Want a great slice of pie with a PRB and a side of 70's nostalgia for $5??  Evel Pie is serving it up everyday along with other specials!  Conveniently located at the Fremont Experience East, this place puts out a cool vibe to grab some unique pizza.    I ordered the $5 special, a slice of cheese and a pint of PBR... a great deal!  Pizza was excellent, thin NY style crust and cheesy!  A must stop for any pizza and Evel Knievel fan!

xtZFgx0Q7eHb_Ub-xgy6Vw.text: Wanted to try this place cause they won an award for gluten free pizza. What I didn't realize was they have 1 gluten free pizza, the Olivia gluten free John.   So don't expect to get anything else. They are not very customer friendly, my wife asked for extra cheese and was told, nope, be too heavy on the pizza, asked for grenadine added to her coke, told nope, don't have it. Have a full bar but no grenadine?   Order at a Counter, no waitress service, for lunch at least and they bring you the pizza. Right after we got ours a homeless guy walked up to our table and asked if he could have some. He was quickly escorted out of the place.  Now for the food, both pizzas were really good. They 20" is all of that, a huge pie with a thin crust very reminiscent of what I've had in a pizza shop in Brooklyn. Plenty of pepperoni was scattered across the top. The Olivia gluten free John was ordered with sausage and onion and was also pretty big, and being deep crust I managed to eat 4 out of 6 pieces. (We took the rest home, looked for the homeless guy to give him some but he was not around).   The music was so loud was nearly impossible to have a conversation. I guess I'm too old but I didn't enjoy the visit at all. Between the ear splitting music and homeless people accosting me, I was disappointed as I was really looking forward to trying this place. It was also expensive, a little north of 70 bucks for 2 pizzas and 3 cokes. I'd prefer waitress service for that kind of money. Pizza was good but everything else drags the review down

TGWh55jjWg7mo8V9UWPrAg.text: I was in Vegas on vacation, and I saw this place on Travel Channel. It was late and I wanted pizza. The style is NY pizza. I ordered a slice of sausage and pepperoni. a9SmHcrvVNn61svmtX5lLg.text: What brought us in? Well, the beer and slice of pizza for $6. I mean that's a good deal so of course three of us got it. I don't really drink beer anymore so I got a vodka soda and it was decent, I could actually taste the vodka (can't say that about every bar in Vegas).   The decor is all evil Knievel, hence the name Evel Pie. This is more of a hole in the wall bar but it does get packed. There are a few tables and small bar so don't expect to always get a seat. The pizza is more ny style and nothing fancy. It's not that bad. Maybe a 5.5 out of 10.

rDkDhI379iB7uacfmX9lug.text: Iconic Downtown Vegas Pizza joint and bar. I got 2 meaty slices, both very good, and then a pbr at the bar. The line can look long, especially on weekends, but you get served pretty fast. Your only problem on weekends would just be seating, especially if you are in a big group. It's got a cool punk rock vibe, in addition to being a tribute to Evel Keneivel. I just sat at the bar when I went, and the bartenders were all cool. Just be aware that the slice pbr $6 special only works if you're getting cheese pizza. Would be down to stop here again if I'm back in town.

I knew I had to get Gang Green when I saw it was a pesto based pizza, and it exceeded my expectations! Crust is incredible, sauce is flavorful, cheese was delicious; I wish I could get Gang Green every day!   $5.50 per slice sounds a bit steep, but the quality is worth the price. They also had some other awesome flavor combinations that I'm excited to go back and experience next time! Definitely one of my new favorite spots in downtown Vegas!

7FYGNRQIJOZQoI5eYFCYOw.text: If you're gluten-free and love a deep dish style pizza, this is the place to go. They have an amazing atmosphere and even better customer service. I also love that they let you build your own GF pizza and you have the option to use Vegan cheese (not sure if the crust is vegan). Their specialty marinara sauce is nothing like I've ever tasted, and I've been craving it ever since.   I hope they open a second location closer to the Strip because we don't make it downtown often enough!   Note: They also have a pretty sweet atmosphere, it's a must-do if you're looking for cool touristy spots to hit up while in town.

CV1oeQKkiEzdh-PmBLjj3g.text: Awesome no frills pizza stop. Think tattoos, stickers, great music and just all around bad-assery with fantastic pizza. Expect a crowd. Expect an animated atmosphere. Don't expect anyone to kiss your ass and you'll truly have a great time.

18dCCWYF-DB1-paCBZypyQ.text: Reminds me of one of my favorite bars that closed down a few years ago in Hawaii - but with better pizza! The crust is killer. Of course we ended up eating more, and drinking more but it was worth it!  Tip: Order the beer on tap or you'll be surprised at how expensive your bottle was!

JsaAg3N2qWHzG-cSNVHegA.text: Ran into a friend who was leaving a downtown casino, a few hundred bucks richer and holding a slice of their house pizza.  I grabbed the slice and threw it to some pigeons.  "C'mon now, you're not eating this ill-conceived slop on my watch. Those toppings looked like deer pellets."  I marched him down to nearby Evel Pie, where we devoured some amazing pesto pizza and a trio of Grandma's meatballs.  Then he left like he was floating on nitrous oxide at the dentist, with this goofy grin, but his life seemed to change for the better after the intervention.  Lesson learned?  One slice of good pizza puts you in a better place than an entire 24" drab-tasting pizza.

I got a slice of the Goblin Sausage and my first thought was, why is it so greasy?! I mean, I know it's pizza but it was a lot more than I am used to having so after using tons of napkins to dab some of that grease off, I was excited to bite into this thing. It is a meat lover's dream filled with pepperoni, ham, italian sausage and bacon. It was hot but was a bit on the soggy side. However, it had just the right amount of cheese and sauce. I would go back to give it another shot.

qgzJoAGzpGDvTr5e3ymDUA.text: Evel Pie makes the vegan pizza that I have always dreamed of experiencing but never got to until recently!! I am vegan and gluten free, which becomes a nuisance when eating out with a large group, but Evel Pie is the place to be for those special accommodations. I ordered a gluten free pizza with vegan cheese and a few veggies. This thing was so delicious that it was worth the $27 (yikes). The pizza it self was a DEEP DISH. Where have you EVER seen a gluten free deep dish pizza?! I am usually accustomed to the paper thin matzo style gluten free crust, so you can imagine my excitement when his beautiful creation came out. It takes 30 minutes to make, but while you wait, they offer a large array of schooling beverages (including ciders and gluten free beer). Once the pizza came it was flaming hot and crispy. The vegan cheese had baked into the sides giving it an extra crunch while the inside was soft and cooked perfectly! Shouts out to Kitty for being the most FABULOUS bartender ever and literally making my entire downtown experience far better!

0iUhYgH40oUBcqPvm9Qa3Q.text: We had walked to what we thought was the end and notice the name Evil Pie. After checking rating, decided to try. ttn_8pm8aK9h5AuTl3hx-g.text: Ok so I should have written this review a few days ago but here it is . I love pizza , who doesn't right ... well I'm super picky about my crust and theirs is amazing light and crisp .... but I've had to go gluten free and have missed pizza so much and gluten free pizza isn't a good as regular, or so I thought .... we ordered a gluten free pizza it's kinda like a deep dish but better ( I'm not a fan off deep dish) and it tasted like regular flour crust , it was light and airy , they add cheese around the outside of the crust and is it AMAZING!!!! I ate it with two guys that were skeptical and honestly don't like gluten free crap but even they were raving about it ! I posted a picture see for yourself !  Great pizza ! Great bartender ! FCz7rU3QBPlGGlYrF2KJIw.text: The pizza was really good but the service was the worst I've experienced. 1st My husband called for pick up was told it takes 15 minutes and was hung up on we thought it was weird that the lady didn't ask about a name on the phone. Upon arrival at the store we are told we needed to wait another 15 minutes and it was us that hung up on her which isn't True because I was sitting right next to my husband as she hung up on him, either way she was extremely rude about it that's not the worst of it. After arguing with me about the fact the we were the ones that hung up on her the front counter lady offers me a drink as she says "for my trouble" she serves me a drink which by the way I'm glad I never touched then she goes and whispers something to the guys making pizza the little white guy then looks at me and says well now she's looking at me and for good reason now I'm suspicious so I'm watching these guys like a hawk. Here's the best part there is a giant guy maybe Mexican and a little white guy the big guy stands in front of the little white guy and I watch the little guy turn around sneeze into his hand and continue making my pizza. I immediately asked for a refund.  I made the payment on my card and it was refunded 28$ but the lady at the counter also charged and additional $12.83 cents to my card maybe her tip for horrible service? No fraudulent.This was on the 1st of July 2019. I called the store the next day only to be told that the store doesn't have a manager and they would have someone call me back. I won't hold my breath. Whoever started this place started a good thing but to allow such a careless bunch to misrepresent you is and abomination to your vision.

DO-LkG5zM0wprbbrUXIJfw.text: This is a really cool pizza beer spot with old vintage pinball and $5 will get you a slice of cheese pizza and a PBR. Can't beat that right! We came in tonight for dinner and beers but unfortunately they were out of their gluten-free pizza so we had to leave.    Last time we were here I told them specifically about my gluten free sensitivity and they highly recommended their gluten free pizza but you had to order the whole pie.  Looking forward to their pizza, our group chose this place tonight based on my diet and what a slap in my face, they were out of gluten-free dough. It wouldn't be ready till the next day. HUGE downfall. Poor example on them. I know they have better potential!! We left and came to El Cortez to eat

W7QxE8Ui92zLPw0picNXaA.text: This is a small, rocker-chic type place. It's dimly lit, has busy decorations (gives a real anarchy vibe), and plays rock music.   Customer service is excellent. The type of people who are in this joint seem to be more grungy and wearing all black/biker wear, and the restaurant decor and vibe itself was a little dark and foreboding (I suppose it's consistent with the name Evel Pizza). So I wouldn't recommend bringing young kids as they might get scared. But the food was DELICIOUS. Their pizza crust is so good, and I would recommend their buffalo chicken wings any day (so fresh and crispy!!!).   This is a great catch for dinner or drunchies (drunk munchies)! And I might just be back in the next couple of days!

6rtFOoY2cFc0M386co9kXg.text: Love this place!  As a kid in the '70's Evel Knievel was my hero.  Fast forward to the present and combine Evel Knievel, a dive bar and pizza all into one....pure gold!    So even though this is a theme bar, it's not just hokey kitsch like far too many places in Vegas.   This place has some seriously good pizza.  Thin crust, NY style, cooked with a hint of char on the crust as it should be.  We got a pizza and pitcher combo deal that was reasonably priced and loved everything about it.  No pretentiousness,  just a comfortable,  chill environment  with some pizza and beer.  All good!

fCFpaEZuWGR-18XXlCkw-A.text: We ordered the snake pizza and it's not what we expected. For the price, one would expect higher quality offerings and an unforgettable experience. But this was not the case. The inconsistency of the dough, the penny-pinching toppings, and the taste was just not there. This has been less-than-satisfactory experience and would not recommend this place.   I recommend Slice of Vegas at the Mandalay Bay Hotel 5/5. By far a hundred times better.

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b2tF1zU3Hkmjox5CbHjGyA.text: This pizza is so good, it could give me AIDS and I'd still eat it. If I was a heroin addict and had to choose between shooting up and a slice from this joint I'd happily go through a pants shitting 3 day withdrawal.

p7bNL4vB4J4G4N1q5t2YIg.text: Evel Pie is that nostalgic, greasy pizza slice served in a non-pretentious environment. You order at the counter, find a seat, and wait for your name to be called signifying that your pizza is hot and toasty. Slices run $4-6 a piece, and although we ordered one per person, I probably could have devoured two for dinner.   The had some basic slices (cheese, sausage, pepperoni) and some interesting creations (hog heaven: candied bacon, BBQ, sausage, ham & mystery slices). It was a nice easy place to stop, and I can easily see why they keep steady customers.   Was it the absolute best pizza ever? Nope. But it was easy enough to fill a craving.

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quick slices of pizza and pop!

yvmso644FXzIirGNTifSLw.text: Came in for lunch and ordered Grandma's balls and a Barry white pie.  The cashier got the order wrong and gave us garlic knots instead of the meatballs but the kitchen fixed it and made them for us anyway which I really appreciate.    The ambiance was pretty cool and they have a good lunch deal for a slice with a beer for 6 bucks.  It was a little loud inside but I can see why it is.    The pizza was outstanding!  My friend said it was probably the best pizza he's had in Vegas (he's a native New Yorker.). The other items were ok but the best.  If we ever came back it would be just for pizza.

xG79sppMUL9xtnNcLuYQYg.text: Omg gluten free deep dish is unheard of...I'm so happy!!! It's good. I was so hungry and had no idea where to find food so late. And it was good!

F1nvGvTG46uIaefXIEoT1w.text: Late post but I visited this spot on 4/20 and I'm glad I did.  First time there and I'm itching to go back. I'm from Cali and have been coming to Vegas since I was a kid and passed this place quite a few times in my past Vegas trips. This time (4/20) was a random turn around trip to Vegas and while roaming around Fremont st, I see a sign (cheese slice and beer $6). Sounds great to me. Now anyone can throw toppings on a pizza and it'd be a decent pizza. But if you can't master a cheese slice you're a buster. These people at Evel Pie ain't busters I'll tell you that. I will be back very soon, specifically for that cheese slice. By the way, stopped in at around 3 pm and had 3 cheese slices and 3 beers. It was so good that I went back at around 9 pm for another slice and beer   S/O to everyone working there by the way. From the dude that took my order to the cook making those pies and even the woman and man who cleaned up our table. Y'all are amazing

mtH5eU9aGaWDd7rGeGCTTg.text: I was very excited to finally try this place. We put in our order, took a seat, and enjoyed the atmosphere   20 minutes later we asked how much longer we would have to wait for our two slices. Turns out they had lost our order. They offered to put it in right away and give us a free slice if we wanted. We declined, just wanting our original order.   10 minutes later we are called. The pizza we were offered was not what was ordered. I pointed out that the order was wrong, and that we needed to go, so I would just like a refund.   Their response was that they could give us an entire pizza for no extra cost. Because we apparently wanted to wait even longer and possibly still not get what we asked for?  After again demanding a refund, finally someone agreed to refund our money. It took a few more minutes to process it, and they could not refund my card, but instead had to give me cash.   Instead of a unique local experience I got a major hassle and had to resort to fast food

R7xUKIBzerJl_FwlSDvXBA.text: Love the Gluten Free crust. It had a great texture and taste.  I wish I had added cheese,  veggies, and maybe a little pesto sauce.....next time.

6biAngmoEPwUzfdQjwhpkw.text: Evil pie is delicious, quick service. Did take out and it was satisfying to all in my group. Pleasant staff. Very close to Fremont Street and the container park.

Vzw9FR86zZJmeQOKaH9vRQ.text: Decided to eat here for lunch/dinner and continue to be amazed with the rocking decor and wonderful staff. The line was a little long this time but so worth their pizza and beer. The prices are still amazing too. Decided to order the pizza by by the slice since a big one would be too much pizza for me. While the memories come back from my early Yelping days I sit here and enjoy pizza and beer. With such great scenery, rockin tunes, and cold beer how could one wrong.

BDZpfM0-5tVe9e3ZwMLsYA.text: Fitting that this hidden downtown bar serves as a dedication to the legendary daredevil Evel Kanevel. One might be attending the Fremont streets-bar for the late night pizza, the specialty drinks, or the back bar band performances. Although not everyone in the room might be a prospective daredevil, there is no doubt each person was searching for their own sense of adventure.  Last night's trip to the Evel Pie was an alternate route off the familiar beaten path of Fremont. There I hung out by the back outside door listening to new aged alternative music. Talked to a few old soul rock musicians. Lip read the lyrics of a few fantastic songs sung by the Donkey Jaw. Then rocked out to a few tunes performed by four Negative Nancies. For me, it was a most positive adventure indeed. One that left the door open for many more adventures ahead.

5zn1cc1LCxDfve_ySITr6w.text: Been craving a slice of good pizza for days and over heard someone talk about this place over on Fremont. I was not disappointed! 5YdruKFIiK5u-SEFKjUdWg.text: First time here andthe food was good but the cashier and bartender were extremely rude hence the reason for the low rating.

aWhDii2rAU1IHizQwcbnZA.text: More of a tourist trap than a pizza place. It took more than 15 minutes for my slice to come out. And all they were doing was heating it up. Also, they don't have Italian seasoning, garlic, or pepper flakes on the tables. This place is more about attracting tourists to spend money that it is about having a good slice of pizza. The slices were unreasonably thin. I got a cheese and a vegan slice and the vegan slice was just little bits of pepperoncini, olive, and onion on top. It's like they were thinking that people that don't eat meat or are vegan just like to eat less. All they had to do is put more vegetables on the slice and it might have been worth it. And they have the audacity to sell it for $6.50. And it's not like the cheese slices any better.  It hardly had any sauce on it and the cheese  wasn't even that flavorful. Again, less of a pizza place and more of a tourist trap. I don't think I've ever written a review on Yelp, but this place definitely motivated me to do it.

p1CAQydIWp3Xjaolm6puZA.text: Great pizza & strong drinks! Very authentic NY style crust. Love the Evel Knievel collection.

IJ2vvX6lKIMolSV9BpqmNw.text: It's got to be REALLY good to inspire me to write a review.  A friend and I randomly stumbled upon Evel Pie after doing the zipline on Fremont St.  We both agreed that it was THE BEST PIZZA WE HAVE EVER EATEN!  It is hard to describe why it is so delicious.  The crust is thin, yet chewy, the toppings are delicious, the cheese is perfectly gooey.  We had slices of the Greek, the Barry White, and a Green pesto one, and they were all delicious.  Prices are reasonable, ambiance is inviting, and staff is friendly.  My new favorite pizza place!  I only regret that I don't live closer, as I plan to return often!

HoQCIPZv0vKLhTSI8dOgaQ.text: Food is delicious, but the staff needs to work on food safety. After dining here with a friend, we both became severely ill and spent a lot of time in the bathroom.

ag15oM_nshhQ3nMqmMk7FA.text: I am a pizza lover. It's one of my favorite foods and thus I'm a harsh judger of pizza! And also of ranch. Having incredible ranch dressing at a pizza place is a must! wVHueLWnJIVSiPv3ldBvfQ.text: This place is fricking awesome. I was tripping balls on shrooms and stumbled into this place. I told the door guy I was lit af and dying of heat. He sat my ass under a fan with an epic view of all that happens on fremont. Not all heros wear capes, this doorman saved my ass!!

LNymZG3opQaGOobPoitOWg.text: My girl friends and I had been planning to come here our next trip to vegas and we were not disappointed. They stay open really late which is great when you're in a place like las vegas that never sleeps. Right away at the front door we were greeted by the nicest and most polite security/host craig! Craig alone made our experience such an enjoyable one, he interacted with everyone throughout their whole visit and really made sure to keep everyone happy. When we first got there we waited in a bit of a line to order but it went super quick. The quantity of people kind of come in waves there it seems. At first it was really busy and there was no places to sit inside but plenty of nice seating outside.. super nice seating! Luckily we got to sit inside before our food came though which didn't take long but was also so hot and fresh when it came out. In total we got a slice of pepperoni pizza, a slice of hogs heaven pizza, and garlic knots. Everything we got had a unique flavor to it and my taste buds were very pleased! I'd totally come here again and again. I recommend this spot to everyone. Also every place needs a Craig!!

arhY-6i-WR3Aezpkl-kKrA.text: Not a bad slice.  Good cheese. Nice atmosphere.  Maybe 2nd to pizza rock just a few blocks away

B8x1oCpSziOYiG5LT4S8ag.text: Great place for an awesome slice of pizza.   Drinks were pretty good too!  Lots of cool memorabilia the check out for the old people who still remember who Evel Knievel is.

yaGxZX_WoQyZTq-tYHu1mw.text: A very substantial addition to the already burgeoning food offers on this block of Fremont. Specializing in pizza (could you tell?), this place channels its inner Butte, Montana to provide the visitor with what feels like a pizza joint that has been here for decades (but in reality only moved in last month).  They do pies and slices. A few specialty slices are interesting: I like the rattlesnake which utilizes real snake and pheasant for the meatballs. What's more metal than snake meat on your pizza?!  What's pizza without beer? They have bottles, draft, and cans to choose from. Good selection of all. If you'd like something a little more heavy, they do have a full bar available, as well as wine.  Great service when I visited. They're doing a good job of working the tourist crowd while keeping things inviting for the locals, too.

eCY6To9NFH1-C12zMIQtJw.text: Sorry, but all my reviews are 5-star reviews (except for a post office review) because I don't like coming on here unless I have something positive to say, but my experience was pretty bad and  I had to vent.    Took about 90 minutes at a very odd hour.  That would have been fine if the pizza had been worth it.  But this was some of the worst pizza I've ever had, and I'm pretty easy to please.  It wasn't even really edible.  Most of the outside of each square was burnt to a crisp.  It was so hard that it basically just shattered in my mouth.  My tooth kills now -- gee, thanks a lot.    And if that weren't enough, the middle part didn't even seem cooked.  It looked and tasted like raw dough that was insanely greasy.  I'm not sure how one manages to burn half of it until it's a black brick, yet the inside looks like it wasn't cooked at all?  Maybe the person who made it was new?  I hope so!  I washed my hands and still haven't gotten the grease off them.  The only reason I didn't give this a one is because I DID like the flavor of the toppings.   If the cheese and toppings were on a different pizza -- one that wasn't a combo of a brick and total mush, then I'd be just fine.   Other than that, not a happy camper.  Waited a long time just to throw it away.

xPfe2DWsRruLT4i9jb7fKw.text: Late on leaving this review. But we stumbled upon this place by accident. Walking around with my kids passed by it and heard music coming out of the doorway. Thought it was just a bar till I saw they served pizza. I didn't think my son(6 years old) would want to go in cause of the music and him being autistic he doesn't like loud places. But he noticed the pizza too. He wanted to go in so we did and we're glad we did! I was nervous going in and waiting for pizza cause I wasn't sure if my son would stay for our whole meal with it having loud music and a small place but he did. The bartenders were super friendly they made him feel comfortable and complimented him on his mohawk. We liked how the pizza was put where you could see. They let my little guy pick what pizza and what particular slice he wanted. He was excited to get to do that since most places don't let you. The slices were big his eyes lit up when the guy pulled the slice he picked! Just want to say thank you to the staff again for making our visit memorable. It was just me and my two kids. With my son it can be hard to find new places to eat. He told my family after our visit about how cool this place was cause it had motorcycles and pizza! We will definitely be going back every chance we get

5AoQebjgpBL2Fm6pEEuHyQ.text: I am a total pizza lover and this place was not the one. Female staff are nice and they did offer a gluten free option which was needed. My boyfriends son is gluten AND dairy free. Even though the gluten free pizza was not coming with cheese and we were willing to pay more for toppings, they would not allow more than 3. They also served us our regular slices of pizza long before the gluten free pizza was done. I know it takes longer for the gluten free, but parents do not want to eat before their kids do. I didn't eat the non-gluten pizza as I just had a regular pepperoni slice, but it was not great and the crust was too hard to eat. The only perk of this place was my boyfriend's son seemed to enjoy the pizza whether it was good or he was just happy to finally have his food (as he is autistic) we will never know. The location is convenient, but if you want good pizza/service and are not pressed for time, I would take the extra time/hassle to go to another spot.

Xk5rx4KNP8l6EsHyxELocw.text: Pizza is very good. Great service. Pizza had been taking long but came over to check on us and apologized for Inconvenience with a pitcher of beer and salad. Pizza came out shortly and was amazing. Definitely a great place to come and eat. Would recommend to come here

RvytxnZ0n3kZV6swdT4tXg.text: This place has a dive bar meets pizza shop vibe, and it seems trendy. The place is littered with random stickers and the vibe is fun, laid back. The framed pictures all over the walls are mostly old vegas imagery, some Even Knievel/motorcycle stuff is hanging as well. I especially like the Evel Knievel arcade games in the back, I wonder where the owner found those gems!   The slices are delicious and the selection is big enough that probably anyone, can find something to eat. They don't concern me but I bet someone who follows a vegan or gluten free diet would appreciate those options on the menu. They are limited, but they're there. With the help of a friend, I tried four different, delicious slices and finished off with the Led Zeppole (fried dough).  I liked the variety of music too, ranging from Social Distortion to Peaches. I'm pretty sure I heard Styx too. Rock on! I'll be back for more.

D3j-HGHgPBcAn2lQbofAeQ.text: Nice and convenient Location,GREAT service! The pizza is not horrible but also nothing special about it. I was expecting a way better tasting pizza for almost $6 a slice.

WPsaa0TDvmvyWLlKGRY0OQ.text: Evel pie has an amazing staff, great prices and great security. They're consistent and always lively. I witnessed there security get called racial slurs and had beer poured on him (on a stab wound he got the night before mind you) just for keeping people out of the alley and he maintained his composer. He also rescued me from being hit on uncomfortabley out front. He rules. The bartender Mandy is a sweet heart, Gary make the best pizza and the manager is amazing as well. I'll be coming back for a long time.

PLYsOHjUZDKE3pJ9uSbuog.text: Great pizza! Cool atmosphere. Definitely a cool stop while down on Fremont street. Check out the back bar. It is a hidden area that is a fun place to hang out.

3DYtHDg318XtN71EQJv_Iw.text: LOVE THIS PLACE.  I know this is weird to say, and I never thought I'd ever say this but THIS PLACE HAS THE BEST FOUNTAIN COKE ever!! I dont know how they do it, why theyre doing it, and who is responsible for all of this, but YO. DAMN. It's like, all other gulps of coke was a lie! You know when you see the coke commercials and people seems to have it all and then they do the AHH moment after the jingle "always coca-cola" and you for real deep down inside wonder if that feeling is truly True? welp, i just had that moment in this joint. What is this sorcery!? lololol  Then, there's their pizza. It's premade, and they pop it back in the oven to warm up and crisp up, and ya know, it's actually pretty good! Nice, think, NY style pizza and Im all for it.  Now, this seems more like a local hang out, so prepare to see some interesting patrons.   I also enjoyed the Evil Knievel decor and inspiration for the place.   All in all, this place is interesting and feels inspired. Not bad for a quick bite to eat and most refreshing coca cola known to man. haha

ycnuPfvaLO3WvAcpVlp0aQ.text: So I was hesitant to buy a $21 gluten free pizza . Glad I did . So happy I wanted to face f*#%k the heck out of it. Get it even if you don't have celiac.

SgLV6Tezzd8EzFaeHa0BRw.text: Great pizza and a great music venue. This is not your traditional pizza place. It definitely has a punk rock vibe with evil Kenevil decor You can order your slice or entire pizza at the bar and they bring it out to your table during the day. This place is more bar like but during the day it's totally fine for kids. The pizza is amazing here the crust is excellent and they have a huge variety of toppings. My favorite pizza here is the gangrene. It has a pesto base sauce and cheese. The gluten free pizzas are the best I have ever had. The gluten free pizzas are pan style and the crust is so unique!  If you come here at night evil pie hosts some of the best local bands on the rear outdoor patio/bar. I definitely recommend coming here for the music seen.

I'm adding an addendum because the manager contacted me and offered to give it another try. The pizza was delicious, but I may of received a small slice. YLWKy54wk24YRHYfwBJ08g.text: This is a long-overdue updated review for Evel Pie.  The owner/manager is extremely friendly and customer service oriented.  He is always bringing in new musicians and specials at both of his locations.  He also makes a point to communicate directly with his patrons to resolve any problems.  Prices are reasonable for the downtown Las Vegas area.  Living in the DTLV area just a few blocks from Fremont, Evel Pie is a frequent stop for us, either to dine in or take out.  The place is always clean, the food hot, and the service fast and extremely friendly!  To me there is still an issue with the garlic knots.  They have changed their recipe but I still do not like them.  Perhaps it is just a personal taste.  To me they are dry, crunchy, and covered with olive oil instead of butter and very little garlic.  I am willing to concede this is a personal taste/preference and not really a problem with the garlic knots themselves as others seem to love them.  Literally everything else there we have tried is yummy.  The pizza is good, great big slices.  My favorite by far are the BBQ wings and their on tap Root Beer (best I've ever had anywhere!)  If you are looking for a fun atmosphere with lots of Americana and nostalgia THIS is the place you want to visit when walking around downtown LV/Fremont Street.  It is loud with rock music, which I personally love.  Be prepared for it to be crowded (always a good sign of good product and service) with happy go lucky people enjoying their time on Fremont Street.  Laid back, friendly environment with good eats.  A must visit DTLV location!

CB0lw_TIKn9LNWEFN77lRg.text: Overpriced decent pizza in a super crowded atmosphere can say the pizza was bad but it didn't blow me away! Pizza rock is a much better choice for some downtown pizza

1QaJIH5r2AyE-0uxmqmmzA.text: It's all about expectations. Fabulous pizza? No, but very good for the $s. And quick. Other expectations exceeded: Older, biz-dressed guy only slightly anxious comes into what feels like a biker dive bar where the guys are big and buffed, and the women are tatted and well-pierced. And it is all "Need anything else?", "No problem!", and "Let me take care of that for you." With a smile. I wish most white tablecloth joints did as well.
