eKvXMnRw3vWGzwWkqHMdmQ.text: I had high expectations for Evel Pie. I read all the reviews and I was really looking forward to giving it a try. I was originally from the NJ/NY area and spent a fair amount of time in those area finding the hidden treasures in Pizza. Cut to the present and I am out searching Las Vegas for the best pizza experience Southern Nevada has to offer.   I purchased a large caramelized onion and roasted pepper pizza with candy bacon on half. It was truly a large pizza, too big for my pizza bag, I will give them that, but from a taste perspective nothing special. Like any pie I could get in any town in Bergen County NJ. The difference is in NJ it would have cost me probably near 20 dollars on the high side and at Evel Pie it was 36 dollars. Like I said it was big so that probably justifies a higher price and its sitting on Freemont St downtown, maybe that's another justification, but 36.00 is a lot of money for that pie in my opinion. But I think it was a letdown with all the hype of the positive reviews. I will not be going back and I would highly recommend Amano in North West Las Vegas or Naked City Pizza near Chinatown or even the Secret Pizza in the Cosmopolitan instead.

HOhBZvLIgHOQ8L_imdn4qw.text: Came here because I was craving pizza and I must say I love this pizza . my husband enjoyed it  It wasn't super greasy which I liked and I like that there was a slight crunch with every bite plus the flavor of the tomato sauce was perfect  Staff was super friendly and they were attentive it's a cool place to just chill and hang out

mbafjh01s-8R-00YC0GXIQ.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. We got mobbed by the crowd on Fremont Street trying to get back to our room at the Golden Nugget, so that kind of gives you a picture lol. The pies were HUGE! Sooo tasty, but not at all greasy. They were devoured in like 5 mins!

Mlm1Icj6LFICjZwNdWoG8w.text: My new Favorite Pizza place in Las Vegas! When we moved to Vegas over a year ago, several people told us about how good Evel Pie was. We finally made it Downtown to check it out and now we wish we would have come sooner.  The crust was perfectly cooked. The sauce was loaded with fresh crushed tomatoes. The three kinds of cheese were oozing with deliciousness, and, the sausage and pepperoni was applied in abundance. The Goblin Sausage Pie is our favorite followed closely by The Barry White Pie. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X0hKSpQ6-Rbb7lMbBLcz0w.text: When it's 1am and you're wrapping up your downtown Las Vegas bar crawl, your tolerance for dropping $5.50 on a slice of pizza just might grow exponentially.  Such was the case when my friend and I found ourselves at Evel Pie after he surrendered to his pizza craving. It looked crowded earlier, but we seemed to hit a temporary dip in the crowd and didn't have to wait too long in line to order. Our slices came out pretty quickly afterward, presumably after they'd been run through the oven quickly to restore them to a high temperature point.  Although my friend was content to go with the $6 deal (cheese slice + house beer, which is the light and bland Evel Ale), I did grab some specialty slices for $5.50. I recalled seeing the Snake River pizza on TV when Evel Pie was featured on an episode of Food Paradise, so I went for it. Frankly, the rattlesnake sausage tasted much like regular pork sausage. The slice was otherwise quite sparsely adorned, so I'm disappointed that I surrendered to that impulse.  I much preferred my second slice, the Balls to the Wall. Massive dollops of ricotta and reasonable amounts of meatball made every bite a treat. I didn't even have to add parmesan or red pepper flakes to this one. The thin crust was otherwise similar to the other piece, substantial and chewy and neither soggy or crunchy.  I don't think I'll flock downtown for Evel Pie, but they're a fine choice for a late night snack if you're walking around Fremont Street.

TgWJU9_i9o_kbeQHrku4Aw.text: I don't know what happened with the first visit. The slices were burnt and they all tasted like cardboard. According to whoever responded to my first review, if that happens, don't assume that they suck and they're overrated like I did, bring it to their attention and they might try to make it right. That's not what happened on my second trip.   Group of people I was hanging out with wanted to refuel downtown, and they picked this spot and I thought, "Why not?" I figured the food traffic would mean fresher slices that don't need as much reheating. I don't know if the foot traffic thing has anything to do with it, but the pizza was good.   It's pricey if you're just here for a slice of pizza, but, if you like beer, you can get a slice and a beer for $6 (according to a sign I saw), and I'm sure ordering a whole pie rather than a slice works out better for your wallet as well. I won't specifically come downtown to eat it, but, if you're nearby and in the mood for pizza, there's a good chance you'll understand why the reviews are so glowing.

DLKxHnUC6LcgpJiB-S7LxQ.text: Ok, so...this is my first Time here and I will 100% be back! The environment here is super chill, the staff are extremely hard working and hilarious. Happy hour special amongst others, $20 for a HUGE cheese pizza and a pitcher of draft beer, you can't beat it. The pizza is amazing, the wings are amazing. I will absolutely drive the 30 mins from my house to come here and eat/relax often.  For anyone who leaves a bad review about decor, flavor or the style of this place, stop being so damn sensitive, this place is fucking amazing.  I'm from Chicago and New York, this pizza is a great New York style.

What more can a local ask for ?....I've tried all the types of pizzas they offer and I recommend them all. Sometimes the wait is long but due to customer traffic but it is definitely worth the wait!

BUnLXNnqRdfErAfrOnrZZQ.text: I give Evel Pie 5 stars because I love the atmosphere, the design, the pizza, the beer etc.   I eat the vegan and veg'd out pizzas.  The vegan meatballs are absolutely addicting and delicious. Also plenty of beer options to wash it all down.   I love this block of Fremont Street a great location for spending several hours.

Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Aa0rrM6P6EaChRc514znQ.text: Thank you Lindsey!! Great service Great pizza Great meatballs Great jager Whole staff was cool! Local. Will return of course.

W_2il6YNVIMPvj_133ZBVg.text: Evel Pie is my favorite place to go. I come here at least a few times a month to hang out with friends and they have the best pizza ever! I've tried almost all of their slices but I must say that a classic pepperoni slice is my favorite. The atmosphere is great, the service is welcoming and friendly, and the live music they have on certain days is pretty cool. I love their events as well. If you are visiting Las Vegas and want a nice space to hang out in, have some great pizza, and enjoy a beer, you absolutely have to visit Evel Pie.

RcY_0drbRzEPnp2fvp26aQ.text: We ate here last night.  The Maui wowie was delicious! My only complaint would be the cashier issues.  We knew there was a slice and a beer $6 special, but did not know it was only for plain cheese, and she didn't explain that either. We had to go over our order with her again and get refunded and re-rang, to achieve the proper order.  Everything was fine beyond that.

9wndvhzTL0c6FP8gnHV-oA.text: The bartender was very friendly. We ordered by the slice. I wish we ordered a whole pizza. The bartender was knowledgeable about the Evel family and told us some stories. Really enjoyed are visit.  We will be back.

JHz8yClZ5WnyTlRa0nSNFQ.text: Live hard, ride fast, eat pizza is their slogan! A fun tribute to Evel Knievel!   This place is a lot of fun and has a dive bar feel to it with great lunch & happy hour specials! It's loud in every way from the decor to the music.   The pizza is great and my favorite is the hog heaven with BBQ sauce, smoked mozzarella, fontina, pulled pork, man candy bacon, red onions and fresh parsley. Every bite is delicious!   There are lots of pizza variations and everything is good from the classic pepperoni to the rattlesnake sausage one!   I love coming here for a quick bite and we always have a good time! Service is friendly and it's a great addition to downtown LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog heaven slice
Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza heaven!

41_kWCUQouIGnGZtKIdj9A.text: We went in twice while visiting freemont street! We loved it! The pizza was amazing and best we have had in a long time!

Ota21d357j0vVt1CMLhAhA.text: Definitely my favorite pizza place in Vegas! I am extremely picky about pizza and get it rarely, but when I do it's almost always here. Their Barry White pizza is my favorite. Very generously sized slices and bartenders are always great with the drinks too! Would absolutely recommend for anyone looking for a great pizza place while in town or as a local looking for a new regular spot.

Y_I3Kp5woDvaLu4gpewiTw.text: Pizza is quality & inexpensive, ice cold beer, love the dive feel, and good service. One of my fav spots downtown!!

OChJQyWRRTjB878WVSh7WQ.text: Fun DTLV place to grab a quick bite and beer or sit down and hangout for a while! We love the pizza and the fun vibes this place offers. Highly recommend!

715MMA21tVnkg6s9nYRstA.text: The pizza was great the service was amazing I think the bartenders name was Megan but she was stellar.   I ate next-door yesterday and I was pissed off when I left.  I left this place with a smile

yB8umjplwvAY9jHXw7buSg.text: This is another well kept secret on Fremont Street. Food is tasty; bartenders are friendly, and a good vibe permeates this establishment. It is so good to get out of the pesky casino's and walk into a bar and enjoy some light hearted banter with bartenders and other patrons. Make this a stop when you are downtown. You wont be disappointed.

sJgDtwh7S-xlYuWfevKbyg.text: Great pizza!! The place is obviously iconic ... Stickers every where from over many years. The pizza took center stage ... If you're in the mood for pizza in Vegas, then this is the place to go!!

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KfdmKUL0WuU6A9fQTtwcMA.text: My new favorite pizza scene! Evel brought back the pizza-by-the-slice atmosphere of the east coast by friendly staff and a huge beer selection! Can't wait to come back for the live bands!

5fxXCvcd0C8KcfOeaD6wGQ.text: Best pizza in town hands down!! I have had just about every type of pizza they offer and I am never disappointed. The $6 slice and beer is a great deal but even if you get a slice of the ready made specialties or order a whole pie of whatever..you cannot go wrong. Even better, they have live music and events on the back patio and it's a great vibe. Thanks Evel Pie

yIlcXvRogz04aez9RIOfpw.text: Super cool dive bar and pizzeria mixed in one. There's so much to see as far as decorations, bumper stickers, and there are knickknacks all over the wall that is hard to get bored here. My only complaint is that the beers were a bit overpriced. Paying eight dollars for a small draft beer seems a little steep, but that is to be expected given the area and that it is Las Vegas. Pizza slices started at $5.50 which is high too. The bartender was super friendly and accommodating, and a lot of the sample a few beers before actually selecting the one we wanted to drink. I think what I like most about this place is that is just such a funky establishment was so many different things all over the place to look at and that is right up my alley.

Ed-mCyIkgU88vmHUw7tVOg.text: I was with someone who had a little too much to drink, and the staff took such good care of her. They called me and informed me that she was in the bathroom sick. After I came to take over, the staff member left and returned with rags so I could clean her up. It was such amazing service. I appreciate you guys so much

uxk1v8Zm8C7uxYXBp286bw.text: This pizza bar is off the chain. No comparison to any national chain restaurant. Eating here is an experience. Great ambience and cool servers. The place has "the it factor". Got the super happy hour $5 slice and beer combo and added a slice of Vegan pizza to try it out. Both had the right amount of cheese and toppings. Crispy crust. Great for people watching. Must go to place when you visit Vegas and down town.

emp1hoUDz-DFubu7nhQ13w.text: Punk rock pizza place. Looks super rad. It's cool that they have vegan options, but there isn't much by-the-slice that's free of animal products (just veggie and sauce only slice).  Also, you can't get the happy hour special on the veggie pizza, nor the $6 for a slice and a PBR, that one should at least be good for the veggie w no cheese option. So yeah, this place is almost perfect but $10 for a veggie slice w no cheese and a PBR is a little steep.  The pizza sauce is dope.

DoaHKThZlBfIvXtS37Bxcg.text: The pizza is pretty good, but Evel is really only worth it when they're running the slice and a beer special I think. Prices are a normal for by the slice but normal for by the slice is kinda high. For a dollar or two more than you pay by the slice you can get a large Brooklyn style 3-topping pizza at Dominos or something. Plus for some reason everyone they ever have at the register seems to be too busy to take your order unless it's Friday or Saturday night.  Come here if you're out on Fremont at night on the weekend, otherwise you're gonna pay $17 for two pieces of pizza and a bud light and feel kinda jipped. But for the times they are running that special and have the staff around because they know they'll be busy, it's a good place to grab a piece of pizza and a beer.

a8PegIxPW7RSCoyDXFTljA.text: Delicious.... You should come here if you are downtown and want pizza. Hot, crunchy, cheesy.. Amazing. Beer is awesome too. That is all...

mcWbH3Hh7ZLQIIcR02hRqQ.text: One bite, everyone knows the rules. 7.8/10 - good NY style pizza. Cool spot in downtown Vegas.

vKJTIoCTN0hSxfb0hjZQsQ.text: Pizza, beer selection, service, and price are all excellent! It gets super busy and seating is limited. Overall very cool place!

xaf_sxvlztPJ4pd7IlwWKA.text: Mason is the best bar back bitch buster on Las Vegas. Donna is cute as a button too. Pizza is also great

zL6uZTkiy2_3gUbdukAl5w.text: Six different people had six different slices and everyone loved it!! Highly recommend this place.

X32J51UA29wDC0NNR5pjGg.text: The only pizza place I've been to that literally only gives a single slice when you order "a slice." It's still good size, good price, PBR on tap of course. Bartender seemed a little disinterested, but he opened up a little.

3juQZDdxDFcaGczyrAw8Gg.text: Pizza is so-so but the beer and alcohol selection is everything. The service is always on point and friendly. This is also a great place to sit back and people watch. The world takes all kinds, right ?   Get the grapefruit beer if you're feeling adventurous.. I loved it !!

RTePidhsXF6LHNhSysnslQ.text: The pizza was disappointing. Probably the blandest white pizza I've ever had. The Caesar salad was hastily made and perfectly mediocre. It came to our table with three forks and no plates and was basically thrown at us by our "server" who was on her way out the door. I know this because she had her backpack on.  My wife and I ate out of the bowl while we wondered who the extra fork was for. When I ordered a beer for my wife, they came back with a pitcher and then gave me attitude about it when I pointed out their mistake. They never fixed it and I ended up paying for that pitcher of beer. When I called the manager, he told me to call my bank and he couldn't have cared less about it. This place is a joke and a pretentious tourist trap.

Ms3Hz-Je3E6BzApKX1l4LA.text: Best gluten free pizza the candied bacon on top was delish and the area has some cool places to walk around thats diffrent than alot of mainstream vegas

6eEz0atPdD8Pb3BIO0QlTA.text: First of all Chris I know you're out there and if you read this curse you. For my bachelor party my friend took me here and said you have to do this. Long story short we had some rattlesnake pizza. I hate snakes....I really really do. If you can kid yourself though it wasn't bad at all. The meat is ground up and seasoned so it's not like there's a snake looking at you so just imagine it's sausage and you'll be just fine....maybe.

2Mh0xBNhCR7G4tibZ3noqw.text: Came across this pizza place by way of site seeing off the strip. OMG!! What a refreshing and fun atmosphere from the normal (if there is a normal). The staff - Very friendly, Very inviting, The Drinks- my skinny Margarita was great, hubby had a great Beer selection, The Food - the pizza by the slice looked yummy! Hubby being Gluten Free, decided to share with him. HANDS DOWN BEST GF PIZZA WE'VE HAD IN THE PAST 5 YEARS! GF's it's a must!! You will not be disappointed !

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CFrOB2JCfl1DHdLgkhZNMg.text: Rattlesnake pizza and the Barry White pizza are a must try.    Cute little pizza joint - pizza is amazing and made hot and fresh.    Only complaint is the lady working the counter overcharged me by over $6... when I brought it to her attention, she gave no apology and seemed annoyed that she has to fix.

1t7xGfhDoPCOmU-vbjf7GQ.text: Something about the dough of the pizza that makes this pizza worth trying and getting another slice. Crispy and chewy, light and flavorful.

qcyfwcrsz7Uicr5FVSOf2w.text: So good! I had the Barry White and it was delicious and creamy. The beer is nice and cold too. My only complaint is that they won't let you leave with your beer and walk a couple hundred feet to Fremont.

AhuDaLHNj4SWbj0EffAJeA.text: What can I say about this place?  It like walking back in time of my childhood in the 70's. Evel Knievel memorabilia check, Evel Ale check, awesome pizza check. This place is one of the best dives I've been too!  Had a blast. Recommend this to anyone that want to step back in time, hang out, have a beer, and play some pinball on a Evel Knievel pinball machine. How awesome is that!!! Definitely a highlight on our trip to Vegas.

ZOCRrp2o2Z44TLCFSiCCTQ.text: Holy googly moogly!! Just had a Balls to the wall and a Hog Heaven and I might have to give up all other pies!! Exceptional, I would have paid $90 in retrospect, thanks for undercharging for magic Evel Pie!

63EP6ZFoum-v-RVwoTYkmA.text: The gluten free crust is amazing!!!!  The vegan cheese is pretty good too! Will definitely come back when we return to Vegas! The environment is pretty fun too!

TrlwJtYLIy8L52oX3n4VJw.text: I have to confess, I did not eat here but....our Lyft driver dropped us off in front and said if you are going to eat pizza this is the place to do it.

oKnl3s4R6HO0DQSkdsdJmw.text: Thank god we found this place. We have been going once a week for some pizza and beer! The place is a total throw back... brings me right back to my childhood. MUST GO!!

eW3JmAthLiz1xmFfE0n-0A.text: I can tell you that I am a pizza snob. I hate most pizza because it's an abomination of breadlike substance with crap on top. Walking down Fremont I saw this place and it reminded me of my favorite pizza place. Popped in and grabbed a pepperoni. Destroyed the slice and ordered a Balls to the Walls (meatballs pepperoni and stuff?) immediately. Delicious. The crust is crisp without being heavy, which is IMO the most important part of pizza. If you want pizza in Vegas, come here no question.

rLDF-y0y7ya3svkr7YdlcA.text: we actually walked in and didn't understand the concept so we walked back out. we came back later and had awesome pizza and drinks for really cheap. the staff here were so down to earth and just overall great people. they really made that night special for us. we went other places and received horrible or rude service like everyone working on or near the strip in Vegas is just completely over life. this place is FIRE. You have for skip a place or two and stop by here.  worth it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Evel Pie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My amazing new friends at Evel Pie

drIK0dpR-cMRyTVF_-f5YQ.text: Not a bad a bad slice of pizza but the operations of this place are a joke.  Waitress took my order for a 5.50 slice of pizza -- paid 10 dollars and never gave me change.  When I asked for my change she unapologetically said I didn't see you still there.  Waited 20 minutes as the overwhelmed staff placed random slices of pizza on the counter.  When asked why they weren't calling any ones names, their only response was we would if we had any idea who ordered what.

MX3WhFvBNI2cFys2fHOz-Q.text: As a native NY'er I was skeptical about the pizza, but wow did evel satisfy my thin crust pizza hunger! Kat is an amazing bartender and I highly recommend coming here for a beer and slice.

zvV9TMoMQO_krWKf_hjJOw.text: This place is awesome! Small but great pizza and service. Stopped in expecting not much for the pizza and was pleasantly surprised. Our bartender Kay, was hilarious and awesome! I will def stop there again next time I am in Vegas!

wS0xINguCEMTm1UIfSYU7w.text: YUM! Cheap and fast too. As far as customer service-- it was ok-- nothing extra special, but did the job! The cheese slice with a beer was 5$. We opted for the specialty pizza that was 5.50 for a huge slice! Would definitely recommend and would return for some pizza!

JFfT33mmbc7C9mv1Dnjyjg.text: Great service! Great food! My bartender Kay was incredible! Definitely check this girl out when you go

ZL3ftKeTqQ0m54sQZ0Uusw.text: Visited a pizza place where they had fun memorabilia all over the walls, good music to listen to, and delicious pizza.  Close to easy parking.  This was a wonderfully good find in downtown Las Vegas.  Try it out!

9r2tbBAQJI6SjxBU39Dtcg.text: Amazing Service & Food. I LOVED my bartender Kaleigh..Omg she was right on it. Food came out hott . Our drinks were always full..& we love it here. I def. Highly recommend them & I plan on coming back everytime in Vegas !

0k1vBaqQw8ZuV0LafBKQTQ.text: Had a pie and pitcher special with a couple of friends.  The service was fantastic as was the pizza.  The atmosphere was cool and casual. I will come back when I am in Vegas.

BJso6ZAbh8YnQkt3to9bzw.text: Love this place. seedy vibe, 70s memorabilia and the pizza was incredible. Would come again

MP5dag4E0JCWxaU54uhBxA.text: Great spot.. Pizza was super fresh and crispy!! Staff was on point all around good vibes and good people.. staff member came running out after us cuz we left our wallet.. real honest good people with real good pies

P2xIyHtNB3HMvTACgDySmw.text: Fun little dive place off Fremont street with friendly staff. Happy hour included a large slice of pizza and beer for only $5.00.  Nice change from the "traditional" Vegas joints. Will be back!!
